trans-unit.source: git-bisect[1]: When there is a regression in your project, one way to track down the bug is by searching through the history to find the exact commit that’s to blame. Git bisect can help you perform a binary search for that commit. It is smart enough to perform a close-to-optimal search even in the case of complex non-linear history with lots of merged branches.
trans-unit.target: git-bisect [1]：当您的项目中存在回归时，一种跟踪错误的方法是搜索历史记录，以查找确切的责任。Git bisect可以帮助您对该提交执行二进制搜索。即使在具有许多合并分支的复杂非线性历史记录的情况下，它也足够聪明以执行接近最佳的搜索。

trans-unit.source: $GIT_SSH_COMMAND takes precedence over $GIT_SSH, and is interpreted by the shell, which allows additional arguments to be included. $GIT_SSH on the other hand must be just the path to a program (which can be a wrapper shell script, if additional arguments are needed).
trans-unit.target: $GIT_SSH_COMMAND 优先于 $GIT_SSH ，并由外壳程序解释，从而允许包含其他参数。另一方面， $GIT_SSH 必须仅是程序的路径（如果需要其他参数，则可以是包装Shell脚本）。

trans-unit.source: <absolute-pathname> - Writes to the file in append mode. If the target already exists and is a directory, the traces will be written to files (one per process) underneath the given directory.
trans-unit.target: <absolute-pathname> -以追加模式写入文件。如果目标已经存在并且是目录，则跟踪将被写入给定目录下的文件（每个进程一个）。

trans-unit.source: <arg-hint>, if specified, is used as a name of the argument in the help output, for options that take arguments. <arg-hint> is terminated by the first whitespace. It is customary to use a dash to separate words in a multi-word argument hint.
trans-unit.target: <arg-hint> （如果已指定）用作帮助输出中参数的名称，用于带有参数的选项。 <arg-hint> 由第一个空格终止。通常使用破折号在多词参数提示中分隔词。

trans-unit.source: <rev>^{object} can be used to make sure <rev> names an object that exists, without requiring <rev> to be a tag, and without dereferencing <rev>; because a tag is already an object, it does not have to be dereferenced even once to get to an object.
trans-unit.target: <rev>^{object} 可用于确保 <rev> 命名存在的对象，而无需将 <rev> 用作标签，也无需取消引用 <rev> ；因为标签已经是一个对象，所以即使到达一个对象也不必取消引用。

trans-unit.source: <rev>^{tag} can be used to ensure that <rev> identifies an existing tag object.
trans-unit.target: <rev>^{tag} 可用于确保 <rev> 标识现有标签对象。

trans-unit.source: <start> and <end> are optional. -L <start> or -L <start>, spans from <start> to end of file. -L ,<end> spans from start of file to <end>.
<start> and <end> can take one of these forms:

trans-unit.source: * if HEAD matches current ref (the checked out branch), ' ' otherwise.

trans-unit.source: --cacheinfo is used to register a file that is not in the current working directory. This is useful for minimum-checkout merging.
trans-unit.target: --cacheinfo 用于注册不在当前工作目录中的文件。这对于最小结帐合并很有用。

trans-unit.target: --contains <commit> 用于查找所有要重新设置或修改<commit>时需要特别注意的分支，因为这些分支包含指定的<commit>。

trans-unit.source: --date=default is the default format, and is similar to --date=rfc2822, with a few exceptions:
trans-unit.target: --date=default 是默认格式，与 --date=rfc2822 相似，但有一些例外：

trans-unit.source: --date=format:... feeds the format ... to your system strftime, except for %z and %Z, which are handled internally. Use --date=format:%c to show the date in your system locale’s preferred format. See the strftime manual for a complete list of format placeholders. When using -local, the correct syntax is --date=format-local:....
trans-unit.target: --date=format:... 喂格式 ... 您的系统 strftime ，除了％z和％Z，这是内部处理。使用 --date=format:%c 以系统区域设置的首选格式显示日期。有关格式占位符的完整列表，请参见 strftime 手册。当使用 -local ，正确的语法是 --date=format-local:... 。

trans-unit.source: --date=human shows the timezone if the timezone does not match the current time-zone, and doesn’t print the whole date if that matches (ie skip printing year for dates that are "this year", but also skip the whole date itself if it’s in the last few days and we can just say what weekday it was). For older dates the hour and minute is also omitted.
trans-unit.target: --date=human 如果时区与当前时区不匹配，则显示时区；如果时区不匹配，则不显示整个日期（即，跳过打印年份为“今年”的日期，但也跳过整个日期）约会本身（如果是最近几天的话，我们可以说是星期几）。对于较早的日期，还会省略小时和分钟。

trans-unit.source: --date=iso-strict (or --date=iso8601-strict) shows timestamps in strict ISO 8601 format.
trans-unit.target: --date=iso-strict （或 --date=iso8601-strict ）以严格的ISO 8601格式显示时间戳。

trans-unit.source: --date=iso (or --date=iso8601) shows timestamps in a ISO 8601-like format. The differences to the strict ISO 8601 format are:
trans-unit.target: --date=iso （或 --date=iso8601 ）以类似于ISO 8601的格式显示时间戳。与严格的ISO 8601格式的区别是：

trans-unit.source: --date=raw shows the date as seconds since the epoch (1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC), followed by a space, and then the timezone as an offset from UTC (a + or - with four digits; the first two are hours, and the second two are minutes). I.e., as if the timestamp were formatted with strftime("%s %z")). Note that the -local option does not affect the seconds-since-epoch value (which is always measured in UTC), but does switch the accompanying timezone value.
trans-unit.target: --date=raw 将日期显示为从纪元（1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC）起的秒数，后跟一个空格，然后是时区，以相对UTC的偏移量（带有四位数字的 + 或 - ；前两个是小时，后两个是分钟）。即，好像时间戳是用 strftime("%s %z") 格式化的。请注意， -local 选项不会影响秒数以来的时间值（始终以UTC度量），但是会切换随附的时区值。

trans-unit.source: --date=relative shows dates relative to the current time, e.g. “2 hours ago”. The -local option has no effect for --date=relative.
trans-unit.target: --date=relative 显示相对于当前时间的日期，例如“ 2小时前”。该 -local 选项有没有效果 --date=relative 。

trans-unit.source: --date=rfc (or --date=rfc2822) shows timestamps in RFC 2822 format, often found in email messages.
trans-unit.target: --date=rfc （或 --date=rfc2822 ）以RFC 2822格式显示时间戳，通常在电子邮件中找到。

trans-unit.source: --date=short shows only the date, but not the time, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
trans-unit.target: --date=short 仅以 YYYY-MM-DD 格式显示日期，而不显示时间。

trans-unit.source: --date=unix shows the date as a Unix epoch timestamp (seconds since 1970). As with --raw, this is always in UTC and therefore -local has no effect.
trans-unit.target: --date=unix 将日期显示为Unix纪元时间戳（自1970年以来的秒数）。与 --raw 一样，这始终是UTC，因此 -local 无效。

trans-unit.source: --force-with-lease alone, without specifying the details, will protect all remote refs that are going to be updated by requiring their current value to be the same as the remote-tracking branch we have for them.
trans-unit.target: --force-with-lease 单独使用--force-with-lease（不指定详细信息），将通过要求它们的当前值与我们为它们提供的远程跟踪分支相同，来保护所有将要更新的远程引用。

trans-unit.source: --force-with-lease=<refname>:<expect> will protect the named ref (alone), if it is going to be updated, by requiring its current value to be the same as the specified value <expect> (which is allowed to be different from the remote-tracking branch we have for the refname, or we do not even have to have such a remote-tracking branch when this form is used). If <expect> is the empty string, then the named ref must not already exist.
trans-unit.target: --force-with-lease=<refname>:<expect> 将保护命名的ref（单独）（如果要更新），方法是要求其当前值与指定的值 <expect> 相同（允许与refname的远程跟踪分支不同，或者使用此格式时甚至不必具有这样的远程跟踪分支）。如果 <expect> 是空字符串，则命名引用必须不存在。

trans-unit.source: --force-with-lease=<refname>, without specifying the expected value, will protect the named ref (alone), if it is going to be updated, by requiring its current value to be the same as the remote-tracking branch we have for it.
trans-unit.target: --force-with-lease=<refname> ，如果不指定期望值，将通过要求其当前值与远程跟踪分支相同来保护命名的ref（单独）（如果要更新）。我们有。

trans-unit.source: --guess is the default behavior. Use --no-guess to disable it.
trans-unit.target: --guess 是默认行为。使用 --no-guess 禁用它。

trans-unit.source: --index-info is a more powerful mechanism that lets you feed multiple entry definitions from the standard input, and designed specifically for scripts. It can take inputs of three formats:
trans-unit.target: --index-info 是一种更强大的机制，可让您从标准输入中提供多个条目定义，并且是专门为脚本设计的。它可以接受三种格式的输入：

trans-unit.source: --info-only is used to register files without placing them in the object database. This is useful for status-only repositories.
trans-unit.target: --info-only 用于注册文件而不将其放置在对象数据库中。这对于仅状态的存储库很有用。

trans-unit.source: --merged is used to find all branches which can be safely deleted, since those branches are fully contained by HEAD.
trans-unit.target: --merged 用于查找可以安全删除的所有分支，因为这些分支完全由HEAD包含。

trans-unit.source: --no-contains <commit> is the inverse of that, i.e. branches that don’t contain the specified <commit>.
trans-unit.target: --no-contains <commit> 是相反的，即不包含指定的<commit>的分支。

trans-unit.source: --no-merged is used to find branches which are candidates for merging into HEAD, since those branches are not fully contained by HEAD.
trans-unit.target: --no-merged 用于查找可以合并到HEAD的候选分支，因为这些分支未完全包含在HEAD中。

trans-unit.source: --no-min-parents and --no-max-parents reset these limits (to no limit) again. Equivalent forms are --min-parents=0 (any commit has 0 or more parents) and --max-parents=-1 (negative numbers denote no upper limit).
trans-unit.target: --no-min-parents 和 --no-max-parents 再次重置这些限制（无限制）。等效形式为 --min-parents=0 （任何提交有0个或多个父级）和 --max-parents=-1 （负数表示没有上限）。

trans-unit.source: --reapply-cherry-picks allows rebase to forgo reading all upstream commits, potentially improving performance.

--refresh does not calculate a new sha1 file or bring the index up to date for mode/content changes. But what it does do is to "re-match" the stat information of a file with the index, so that you can refresh the index for a file that hasn’t been changed but where the stat entry is out of date.
trans-unit.target: --refresh 不会计算新的sha1文件，也不会为模式/内容更改更新索引。但是，它的作用是将文件的统计信息与索引“重新匹配”，以便您可以刷新未更改但统计条目已过期的文件的索引。

trans-unit.source: --staged is exactly like --cached, which is used to ask a command to only work on the index, not the working tree.
trans-unit.target: --staged 就像 --cached 一样，后者用于要求命令仅在索引上工作，而不在工作树上工作。

trans-unit.source: --type=color [--default=<default>] is preferred over --get-color (but note that --get-color will omit the trailing newline printed by --type=color).
trans-unit.target: --type=color [--default=<default>] 优于 --get-color （但请注意， --get-color --type=color -color将忽略由--type = color打印的尾随换行符）。

trans-unit.source: --worktree is the opposite, to ask a command to work on the working tree only, not the index.
trans-unit.target: --worktree 相反，只要求命令在工作树上工作，而不是索引。

trans-unit.source: 0000 Flush Packet (flush-pkt) - indicates the end of a message
trans-unit.target: 0000 刷新数据包（flush-pkt）-指示消息的结尾

trans-unit.source: 0001 Delimiter Packet (delim-pkt) - separates sections of a message
trans-unit.target: 0001 分隔符数据包（delim-pkt）-分隔消息的各个部分

trans-unit.source: 0002 Message Packet (response-end-pkt) - indicates the end of a response for stateless connections
040000: A subdirectory. Subdirectories can only be specified by SHA or through a tree mark set with --import-marks.
trans-unit.target: 040000 ：子目录。子目录只能由SHA或通过设置了 --import-marks 的树标记指定。

trans-unit.source: 0xxx is an octal number and each file will have mode 0xxx. 0xxx will override users' umask(2) value (and not only loosen permissions as group and all does). 0640 will create a repository which is group-readable, but not group-writable or accessible to others. 0660 will create a repo that is readable and writable to the current user and group, but inaccessible to others.
trans-unit.target: 0xxx 是一个八进制数字，每个文件的模式都为 0xxx 。 0xxx 将覆盖用户的umask（2）值（并且不仅会像 group 一样松散权限，而且 all 也会这样做）。 0640 将创建一个可组可读但不能组写或不能被其他人访问的存储库。 0660 将创建当前用户和组可读写的存储库，但其他用户则不可访问。

trans-unit.source: 100644 or 644: A normal (not-executable) file. The majority of files in most projects use this mode. If in doubt, this is what you want.
trans-unit.target: 100644 或 644 ：普通（不可执行）文件。大多数项目中的大多数文件都使用此模式。如有疑问，这就是您想要的。

trans-unit.source: 100755 or 755: A normal, but executable, file.
trans-unit.target: 100755 或 755 ：正常但可执行的文件。

trans-unit.source: 120000: A symlink, the content of the file will be the link target.
trans-unit.target: 120000 ：符号链接，文件内容将成为链接目标。

trans-unit.source: 160000: A gitlink, SHA-1 of the object refers to a commit in another repository. Git links can only be specified by SHA or through a commit mark. They are used to implement submodules.
trans-unit.target: 160000 ：对象的gitlink SHA-1引用了另一个存储库中的提交。Git链接只能由SHA或通过提交标记指定。它们用于实现子模块。

trans-unit.source: 1 - the original wire protocol with the addition of a version string in the initial response from the server.
trans-unit.target: 1 -原始有线协议，在服务器的初始响应中添加了版本字符串。
@ 单独是 HEAD 的快捷方式。

trans-unit.source: B contains the same change as A. Its merge M is trivial and hence TREESAME to all parents.
trans-unit.target: B 包含与 A 相同的更改。它的合并 M 很小，因此对所有父级都是TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: C does not change foo, but its merge N changes it to “foobar”, so it is not TREESAME to any parent.
trans-unit.target: C 不会更改 foo ，但是其合并 N 会将其更改为“ foobar”，因此对于任何父级而言，它都不是TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: D sets foo to “baz”. Its merge O combines the strings from N and D to “foobarbaz”; i.e., it is not TREESAME to any parent.
trans-unit.target: D 将 foo 设置为“ baz”。它的合并 O 将 N 和 D 到“ foobarbaz” 的字符串组合在一起；即，对任何父母都不是TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: E changes quux to “xyzzy”, and its merge P combines the strings to “quux xyzzy”. P is TREESAME to O, but not to E.
trans-unit.target: E 将 quux 更改为“ xyzzy”，其合并 P 将字符串组合为“ quux xyzzy”。 P 是TREESAME到 O ，但不 E 。

trans-unit.source: GIT_TRACE2_EVENT_NESTING or trace2.eventNesting can be used to filter deeply nested regions and data events. It defaults to "2".
trans-unit.target: GIT_TRACE2_EVENT_NESTING 或 trace2.eventNesting 可用于过滤深度嵌套的区域和数据事件。默认为“ 2”。

trans-unit.source: HEAD names the commit on which you based the changes in the working tree. FETCH_HEAD records the branch which you fetched from a remote repository with your last git fetch invocation. ORIG_HEAD is created by commands that move your HEAD in a drastic way, to record the position of the HEAD before their operation, so that you can easily change the tip of the branch back to the state before you ran them. MERGE_HEAD records the commit(s) which you are merging into your branch when you run git merge. CHERRY_PICK_HEAD records the commit which you are cherry-picking when you run git cherry-pick.
trans-unit.target: HEAD 命名工作树中所做更改的基础提交。 FETCH_HEAD 记录您最近一次 git fetch 调用从远程存储库获取的分支。 ORIG_HEAD 是由命令创建的，这些命令以剧烈的方式移动 HEAD ，以在操作之前记录 HEAD 的位置，以便您可以在运行它们之前轻松地将分支的尖端更改回状态。 MERGE_HEAD 记录运行 git merge 时要合并到分支中的提交。 CHERRY_PICK_HEAD 记录您在运行 git cherry-pick 时选择的提交。

trans-unit.source: HEAD normally refers to a named branch (e.g. master). Meanwhile, each branch refers to a specific commit. Let’s look at a repo with three commits, one of them tagged, and with branch master checked out:
trans-unit.target: HEAD 通常是指一个命名分支（例如 master ）。同时，每个分支都引用一个特定的提交。让我们看一个带有三个提交的仓库，其中三个提交被标记，并且分支 master 签出：

trans-unit.source: I is the initial commit, in which foo exists with contents “asdf”, and a file quux exists with contents “quux”. Initial commits are compared to an empty tree, so I is !TREESAME.
trans-unit.target: I 是最初的提交，其中 foo 存在，内容为“ asdf”，文件 quux 存在，内容为“ quux”。初始提交与一棵空树进行比较，所以 I 是！TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: M was excluded because it is TREESAME to both parents. E, C and B were all walked, but only B was !TREESAME, so the others do not appear.
trans-unit.target: M 被排除在外，因为对双方父母都是TREESAME。 E ， C 和 B 都走了，但是只有 B 是！TREESAME，所以其他的都没有出现。

trans-unit.source: N's parent list had I removed, because it is an ancestor of the other parent M. Still, N remained because it is !TREESAME.
trans-unit.target: N I 删除了N的父级列表，因为它是另一个父级 M 的祖先。仍然保留 N ,因为它是！TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: P's parent list similarly had I removed. P was then removed completely, because it had one parent and is TREESAME.
trans-unit.target: P I 删除了P的父列表。然后将 P 完全删除，因为它有一个父对象并且是TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: Push: lines are used by git push and Pull: lines are used by git pull and git fetch. Multiple Push: and Pull: lines may be specified for additional branch mappings.
trans-unit.target: Push: 线使用 git push 和 Pull: 线通过使用 git pull 和 git fetch 。可以为多个分支映射指定多个 Push: 和 Pull: 行。

trans-unit.source: Q's parent list had Y simplified to X. X was then removed, because it was a TREESAME root. Q was then removed completely, because it had one parent and is TREESAME.
trans-unit.target: Q 的父目录有 Y 简化为 X 。然后删除 X ，因为它是TREESAME根。然后将 Q 完全删除，因为它有一个父代且为TREESAME。

trans-unit.source: X is an independent root commit that added a new file side, and Y modified it. Y is TREESAME to X. Its merge Q added side to P, and Q is TREESAME to P, but not to Y.
trans-unit.target: X 是一个独立的根提交，它添加了一个新的文件 side ，而 Y 对其进行了修改。 Y 是 X 的 TREESAME 。它合并 Q 加 side 对 P 和 Q 是TREESAME到 P ，而不是 Y 。

trans-unit.source: X means any state and U means an unmerged index.
trans-unit.target: X 表示任何状态， U 表示未合并的索引。

trans-unit.source: [2-9] - Writes to the already opened file descriptor.
ada suitable for source code in the Ada language.
af_unix:[<socket_type>:]<absolute-pathname> - Write to a Unix DomainSocket (on platforms that support them). Socket type can be either stream or dgram; if omitted Git will try both.
trans-unit.target: af_unix:[<socket_type>:]<absolute-pathname> -写入Unix DomainSocket（在支持它们的平台上）。套接字类型可以是 stream 或 dgram ；如果省略，Git将尝试两者。

trans-unit.source: all - Also shows individual files in untracked directories.
trans-unit.target: all -还显示未跟踪目录中的单个文件。

trans-unit.source: all - Show also individual files in untracked directories.
trans-unit.target: all -还显示未跟踪目录中的单个文件。

trans-unit.source: all will suppress all auto cc values.
always - Unconditionally allow the server to delegate.
always - protocol is always able to be used.

trans-unit.source: anyauth - Automatically pick a suitable authentication method. It is assumed that the proxy answers an unauthenticated request with a 407 status code and one or more Proxy-authenticate headers with supported authentication methods. This is the default.
trans-unit.target: anyauth -自动选择合适的身份验证方法。假定代理使用407状态代码和一个或多个代理身份验证标头（使用受支持的身份验证方法）回答未经身份验证的请求。这是默认值。

trans-unit.source: author will avoid including the patch author.
bash suitable for source code in the Bourne-Again SHell language. Covers a superset of POSIX shell function definitions.
bibtex suitable for files with BibTeX coded references.
trans-unit.target: bibtex 适用于带有BibTeX编码参考的文件。

trans-unit.source: blank-at-eof treats blank lines added at the end of file as an error (enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: blank-at-eof 将在文件末尾添加的空白行视为错误（默认情况下启用）。

trans-unit.source: blank-at-eol treats trailing whitespaces at the end of the line as an error (enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: blank-at-eol 将行尾的尾部空白视为错误（默认情况下启用）。

trans-unit.source: bodycc will avoid including anyone mentioned in Cc lines in the patch body (commit message) except for self (use self for that).
trans-unit.target: bodycc 除self（为此使用 self ）之外，bodycc会避免在补丁程序主体（提交消息）中的Cc行中提及任何人。

trans-unit.source: bool-or-int: canonicalize according to either bool or int, as described above.
trans-unit.target: bool-or-int ：如上所述，根据 bool 或 int 规范化。

trans-unit.source: cc will avoid including anyone mentioned in Cc lines in the patch header except for self (use self for that).
trans-unit.target: cc 会避免在补丁标头中的Cc行中提及的任何人（除了self之外）（为此使用 self ）。

trans-unit.source: cc will confirm before sending when send-email has automatically added addresses from the patch to the Cc list
trans-unit.target: cc 当send-email已自动将地址从补丁添加到“抄送”列表中时，cc将在发送前确认

trans-unit.source: color: When getting a value, canonicalize by converting to an ANSI color escape sequence. When setting a value, a sanity-check is performed to ensure that the given value is canonicalize-able as an ANSI color, but it is written as-is.
trans-unit.target: color ：获取值时，可通过转换为ANSI颜色转义序列进行规范化。设置值时，将执行完整性检查以确保给定值可以规范化为ANSI颜色，但按原样编写。

trans-unit.source: committer, commits are grouped by committer (the same as -c)
compose will confirm before sending the first message when using --compose.
trans-unit.target: compose 当使用--compose时，compose将在发送第一条消息之前进行确认。

trans-unit.source: core.sparseCheckout is recommended per working tree, unless you are sure you always use sparse checkout for all working trees.
trans-unit.target: core.sparseCheckout 建议对每个工作树建议使用core.sparseCheckout，除非您确定始终对所有工作树都使用稀疏检查。

trans-unit.source: core.untrackedCache=true enables the untracked cache. This setting assumes that mtime is working on your machine.
trans-unit.target: core.untrackedCache=true 启用未跟踪的缓存。此设置假定mtime在您的计算机上正常工作。

trans-unit.source: cpp suitable for source code in the C and C++ languages.
trans-unit.target: cpp 适用于C和C ++语言的源代码。

trans-unit.source: cr-at-eol treats a carriage-return at the end of line as part of the line terminator, i.e. with it, trailing-space does not trigger if the character before such a carriage-return is not a whitespace (not enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: cr-at-eol 将行尾的回车符视为行终止符的一部分，即，如果在回车符之前的字符不是 trailing-space 则不会触发尾随空格（默认情况下未启用） ）。

trans-unit.source: csharp suitable for source code in the C# language.
current - push the current branch to update a branch with the same name on the receiving end. Works in both central and non-central workflows.
trans-unit.target: current -推送当前分支以在接收端更新具有相同名称的分支。在中央和非中央工作流程中均可使用。

trans-unit.source: digest - HTTP Digest authentication; this prevents the password from being transmitted to the proxy in clear text
trans-unit.target: digest -HTTP摘要身份验证；这样可以防止密码以明文形式传输到代理

trans-unit.source: elixir suitable for source code in the Elixir language.
error-all is similar to error but shows all errors.
trans-unit.target: error-all 与 error 类似，但显示所有错误。

trans-unit.source: error outputs warnings for a few such errors, and refuses to apply the patch.
trans-unit.target: error 输出一些此类错误的警告，并拒绝应用补丁。

trans-unit.source: expiry-date: canonicalize by converting from a fixed or relative date-string to a timestamp. This specifier has no effect when setting the value.
trans-unit.target: expiry-date ：通过将固定或相对日期字符串转换为时间戳来规范化。设置值时，该说明符无效。

trans-unit.source: fetch.negotiationAlgorithm=skipping may improve fetch negotiation times by skipping more commits at a time, reducing the number of round trips.
trans-unit.target: fetch.negotiationAlgorithm=skipping 可以一次跳过更多提交，从而减少往返次数，从而可以缩短获取协商的时间。

trans-unit.source: fetch.writeCommitGraph=true writes a commit-graph after every git fetch command that downloads a pack-file from a remote. Using the --split option, most executions will create a very small commit-graph file on top of the existing commit-graph file(s). Occasionally, these files will merge and the write may take longer. Having an updated commit-graph file helps performance of many Git commands, including git merge-base, git push -f, and git log --graph.
trans-unit.target: fetch.writeCommitGraph=true 在每个从远程下载包文件的 git fetch 命令之后写入一个提交图。使用 --split 选项，大多数执行将在现有提交图文件之上创建一个非常小的提交图文件。有时，这些文件将合并，并且写入可能需要更长的时间。拥有更新的提交图文件有助于许多Git命令的性能，包括 git merge-base ， git push -f 和 git log --graph 。

trans-unit.source: fetch is the command used to fetch a packfile in v2. It can be looked at as a modified version of the v1 fetch where the ref-advertisement is stripped out (since the ls-refs command fills that role) and the message format is tweaked to eliminate redundancies and permit easy addition of future extensions.
trans-unit.target: fetch 是用于在v2中获取打包文件的命令。可以将其视为v1获取的修改版本，其中删除了ref-advertisement（因为 ls-refs 命令担当了该角色），并且对消息格式进行了调整以消除冗余并允许轻松添加将来的扩展。

trans-unit.source: file: any local file-based path (including file:// URLs, or local paths)
trans-unit.target: file ：任何基于本地文件的路径（包括 file:// URL或本地路径）

trans-unit.source: fix outputs warnings for a few such errors, and applies the patch after fixing them (strip is a synonym --- the tool used to consider only trailing whitespace characters as errors, and the fix involved stripping them, but modern Gits do more).
trans-unit.target: fix 输出针对一些此类错误的警告，并在修复它们后应用补丁（ strip 是同义词---用于仅将尾随空白字符视为错误的工具，并且该修复涉及 stripping 它们，但是现代Git的作用更多）。

trans-unit.source: for-each-ref can take a wide range of options. See git-for-each-ref[1]
trans-unit.target: for-each-ref 可以采用多种选择。参见git-for-each-ref [1]

trans-unit.source: fortran suitable for source code in the Fortran language.
get_sha1() returns 0 on success. This might surprise some new Git hackers, but there is a long tradition in UNIX to return different negative numbers in case of different errors—​and 0 on success.
trans-unit.target: get_sha1() success 返回0 。这可能会让一些新的Git黑客感到惊讶，但是UNIX中有很长的传统，如果发生不同的错误，则返回不同的负数-成功则返回0。

trans-unit.source: git add itself does not touch the files in the work tree, the next checkout would, so the safety triggers;
trans-unit.target: git add 本身不会碰到工作树中的文件，下次会结帐，因此会触发安全性；

trans-unit.source: git apply command can be used with --cached and --index (but not at the same time). Usually the command only affects the files in the working tree, but with --index, it patches both the files and their index entries, and with --cached, it modifies only the index entries.
trans-unit.target: git apply 命令可以与 --cached 和 --index 一起使用（但不能同时使用）。通常，该命令仅影响工作树中的文件，但使用 --index 时，它将修补文件及其索引条目，而使用 --cached 时，仅修改索引条目。

trans-unit.source: git apply to update a text file with a patch does touch the files in the work tree, but the operation is about text files and CRLF conversion is about fixing the line ending inconsistencies, so the safety does not trigger;
trans-unit.target: git apply 用补丁更新文本文件确实会触及工作树中的文件，但是操作是关于文本文件的，而CRLF转换是关于解决行尾不一致的问题，因此不会触发安全性；

trans-unit.source: git archimport uses tla extensively in the background to access the Arch repository. Make sure you have a recent version of tla available in the path. tla must know about the repositories you pass to git archimport.
trans-unit.target: git archimport 在后台广泛使用 tla 来访问Arch存储库。确保路径中有可用的 tla 最新版本。 tla 必须了解您传递给 git archimport 的存储库。

trans-unit.source: git archive behaves differently when given a tree ID versus when given a commit ID or tag ID. In the first case the current time is used as the modification time of each file in the archive. In the latter case the commit time as recorded in the referenced commit object is used instead. Additionally the commit ID is stored in a global extended pax header if the tar format is used; it can be extracted using git get-tar-commit-id. In ZIP files it is stored as a file comment.
trans-unit.target: git archive 当给定树ID与给定提交ID或标签ID时，git存档的行为有所不同。在第一种情况下，当前时间用作存档中每个文件的修改时间。在后一种情况下，将使用在引用的提交对象中记录的提交时间。另外，如果使用tar格式，则提交ID将存储在全局扩展pax标头中。可以使用 git get-tar-commit-id 提取它。在ZIP文件中，它作为文件注释存储。

trans-unit.source: git bundle will only package references that are shown by git show-ref: this includes heads, tags, and remote heads. References such as master~1 cannot be packaged, but are perfectly suitable for defining the basis. More than one reference may be packaged, and more than one basis can be specified. The objects packaged are those not contained in the union of the given bases. Each basis can be specified explicitly (e.g. ^master~10), or implicitly (e.g. master~10..master, --since=10.days.ago master).
trans-unit.target: git bundle 将只打包由 git show-ref 显示的引用：这包括标题，标签和远程标题。参考文献如 master~1 不能被包装，但是完全适合于限定的基础。可以打包多个参考，并且可以指定一个以上的基础。打包的对象是那些不包含在给定基数的并集中的对象。每个基础可以显式指定（例如 ^master~10 master~10..master ），也可以隐式指定（例如master〜10..master，-- --since=10.days.ago master ）。

trans-unit.source: git checkout-index will "export" the index into the specified directory.
trans-unit.target: git checkout-index 会将索引 “导出”到指定目录。

trans-unit.source: git checkout refuses when the wanted ref is already checked out by another worktree. This option makes it check the ref out anyway. In other words, the ref can be held by more than one worktree.
trans-unit.target: git checkout 当所需的引用已经被另一个工作树检出时，git checkout拒绝。此选项使它仍然可以检查引用。换句话说，ref可以由一个以上的工作树保存。

trans-unit.source: git citool is actually a standard alias for git gui citool. See git-gui[1] for more details.
trans-unit.target: git citool 实际上是 git gui citool 的标准别名。有关更多详细信息，请参见git-gui [1]。

trans-unit.source: git clone can use any bundle created without negative refspecs (e.g., new, but not old..new). If you want to match git clone --mirror, which would include your refs such as refs/remotes/*, use --all. If you want to provide the same set of refs that a clone directly from the source repository would get, use --branches --tags for the <git-rev-list-args>.
trans-unit.target: git clone 可以使用没有否定引用创建的任何捆绑包（例如， new ，而不是 old..new ）。如果要匹配 git clone --mirror ，其中将包括 refs/remotes/* 等引用，请使用 --all 。如果要提供与直接从源存储库获得的克隆相同的引用集，请对 <git-rev-list-args> 使用 --branches --tags 。

trans-unit.source: git clone does not clone branches under the refs/remotes/ hierarchy or any git svn metadata, or config. So repositories created and managed with using git svn should use rsync for cloning, if cloning is to be done at all.
trans-unit.target: git clone 不会在refs / remotes /层次结构或任何 git svn 元数据或配置下克隆分支。因此，如果要完全克隆，则使用 git svn 创建和管理的存储库应使用 rsync 进行克隆。

trans-unit.source: git clone, git fetch and git pull, but not git push, will also accept a suitable bundle file. See git-bundle[1].
trans-unit.target: git clone ， git fetch 和 git pull ，但不是 git push ，也将接受合适的捆绑文件。参见git-bundle [1]。

trans-unit.source: git commit-tree normally takes several arguments — it wants to know what the parent of a commit was, but since this is the first commit ever in this new repository, and it has no parents, we only need to pass in the object name of the tree. However, git commit-tree also wants to get a commit message on its standard input, and it will write out the resulting object name for the commit to its standard output.
trans-unit.target: git commit-tree 通常接受几个参数-它想知道提交的 parent 是什么，但是由于这是该新存储库中的第一个提交，并且没有父级，因此我们只需要传入对象名那个树。但是， git commit-tree 也希望在其标准输入上获得一条提交消息，并且它将为该标准输出写出提交的结果对象名称。

trans-unit.source: git commit-tree will return the name of the object that represents that commit, and you should save it away for later use. Normally, you’d commit a new HEAD state, and while Git doesn’t care where you save the note about that state, in practice we tend to just write the result to the file pointed at by .git/HEAD, so that we can always see what the last committed state was.
trans-unit.target: git commit-tree 将返回代表该提交的对象的名称，您应该将其保存以备后用。通常，您会提交一个新的 HEAD 状态，尽管Git不在乎您保存该状态的注释的位置，但实际上，我们倾向于将结果 .git/HEAD 指向的文件中，这样我们总是可以看到最后一个提交状态。

trans-unit.source: git commit and git commit-tree issues a warning if the commit log message given to it does not look like a valid UTF-8 string, unless you explicitly say your project uses a legacy encoding. The way to say this is to have i18n.commitencoding in .git/config file, like this:
trans-unit.target: git commit 如果给它的提交日志消息看起来不像是有效的UTF-8字符串，则git commit和 git commit-tree 会发出警告，除非您明确地说项目使用了旧式编码。这样说的方法是在 .git/config 文件中包含i18n.commitencoding ，如下所示：

trans-unit.source: git config will ensure that any input or output is valid under the given type constraint(s), and will canonicalize outgoing values in <type>'s canonical form.
trans-unit.target: git config 将确保任何输入或输出在给定的类型约束下都是有效的，并将以 <type> 的规范形式规范输出值。

trans-unit.source: git credential reads and/or writes (depending on the action used) credential information in its standard input/output. This information can correspond either to keys for which git credential will obtain the login information (e.g. host, protocol, path), or to the actual credential data to be obtained (username/password).

git credential reads and/or writes (depending on the action used) credential information in its standard input/output. This information can correspond either to keys for which git credential will obtain the login/password information (e.g. host, protocol, path), or to the actual credential data to be obtained (login/password).
trans-unit.target: git credential 在其标准输入/输出中读取和/或写入（取决于使用的操作）凭证信息。此信息可以对应于 git credential 将为其获取登录/密码信息（例如主机，协议，路径）的密钥，也可以对应于将要获取的实际凭证数据（登录/密码）。

trans-unit.source: git cvsimport will make it appear as those authors had their GIT_AUTHOR_NAME and GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL set properly all along. If a time zone is specified, GIT_AUTHOR_DATE will have the corresponding offset applied.
trans-unit.target: git cvsimport 会使其一直显示为这些作者的GIT_AUTHOR_NAME和GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL一直正确设置。如果指定了时区，则GIT_AUTHOR_DATE将应用相应的偏移量。

trans-unit.source: git daemon will set REMOTE_ADDR to the IP address of the client that connected to it, if the IP address is available. REMOTE_ADDR will be available in the environment of hooks called when services are performed.
trans-unit.target: git daemon 会将REMOTE_ADDR设置为与其连接的客户端的IP地址（如果IP地址可用）。REMOTE_ADDR将在执行服务时调用的挂钩环境中可用。

trans-unit.source: git diff-files compares contents of the index file and the working directory;
trans-unit.target: git diff-files 比较索引文件和工作目录的内容；

trans-unit.source: git diff-index compares contents of a "tree" object and the working directory (when --cached flag is not used) or a "tree" object and the index file (when --cached flag is used);
trans-unit.target: git diff-index 比较“树”对象和工作目录（当不使用 --cached 标志时）或“树”对象和索引文件（当使用 --cached 标志时）的内容；

trans-unit.source: git diff-index really always uses the index for its comparisons, and saying that it compares a tree against the working tree is thus not strictly accurate. In particular, the list of files to compare (the "meta-data") always comes from the index file, regardless of whether the --cached flag is used or not. The --cached flag really only determines whether the file contents to be compared come from the working tree or not.
trans-unit.target: git diff-index 实际上总是使用索引进行比较，因此说严格将树与工作树进行比较是不准确的。特别是，要比较的文件列表（“元数据”）始终来自索引文件，而不管是否使用 --cached 标志。该 --cached 标志真的只确定是否将文件内容进行比较来自工作树与否。

trans-unit.source: git diff-tree can be given two arbitrary trees, and it will tell you the differences between them. Perhaps even more commonly, though, you can give it just a single commit object, and it will figure out the parent of that commit itself, and show the difference directly. Thus, to get the same diff that we’ve already seen several times, we can now do
trans-unit.target: git diff-tree 可以给两个任意树，它将告诉您它们之间的区别。不过，也许甚至更常见的是，您可以只给它一个提交对象，它将找出该提交本身的父对象，并直接显示差异。因此，为了获得与我们已经见过几次相同的差异，我们现在可以

trans-unit.source: git diff-tree compares contents of two "tree" objects;
trans-unit.target: git diff-tree 比较两个“树”对象的内容；

trans-unit.source: git diff-tree outputs a line with the commit ID when applicable. This flag suppressed the commit ID output.
trans-unit.target: git diff-tree 适用时输出带有提交ID的行。该标志禁止提交ID输出。

trans-unit.source: git diff itself does not touch the files in the work tree, it is often run to inspect the changes you intend to next git add. To catch potential problems early, safety triggers.
trans-unit.target: git diff 本身不会触及工作树中的文件，因此通常会运行它来检查您打算在下一个 git add 中进行的更改。为了尽早发现潜在问题，安全触发。

trans-unit.source: git difftool falls back to git mergetool config variables when the difftool equivalents have not been defined.
trans-unit.target: git difftool 当尚未定义difftool等效项时，git difftool会退回到 git mergetool 配置变量。

trans-unit.source: git difftool is a Git command that allows you to compare and edit files between revisions using common diff tools. git difftool is a frontend to git diff and accepts the same options and arguments. See git-diff[1].
trans-unit.target: git difftool 是一个Git命令，允许您使用常见的diff工具在修订之间比较和编辑文件。 git difftool 是 git diff 的前端，并接受相同的选项和参数。参见git-diff [1]。

trans-unit.source: git difftool's default behavior is create symlinks to the working tree when run in --dir-diff mode and the right-hand side of the comparison yields the same content as the file in the working tree.
trans-unit.target: git difftool 的默认行为是在 --dir-diff 模式下运行时，创建到工作树的符号链接，并且比较的右侧产生与工作树中文件相同的内容。

trans-unit.source: git fetch can fetch from either a single named repository or URL, or from several repositories at once if <group> is given and there is a remotes.<group> entry in the configuration file. (See git-config[1]).
trans-unit.target: git fetch 可以从单个命名存储库或URL进行获取，也可以一次从多个存储库获取（如果给出了<group>且配置文件中有一个remotes。<group>条目）。 （请参见git-config [1]）。

trans-unit.source: git filter-branch has a plethora of pitfalls that can produce non-obvious manglings of the intended history rewrite (and can leave you with little time to investigate such problems since it has such abysmal performance). These safety and performance issues cannot be backward compatibly fixed and as such, its use is not recommended. Please use an alternative history filtering tool such as git filter-repo. If you still need to use git filter-branch, please carefully read SAFETY (and PERFORMANCE) to learn about the land mines of filter-branch, and then vigilantly avoid as many of the hazards listed there as reasonably possible.
trans-unit.target: git filter-branch 有很多陷阱，它们可能会对预期的历史记录重写产生明显的干扰（并且由于性能如此糟糕，因此您几乎没有时间去研究此类问题）。这些安全和性能问题无法向后兼容解决，因此，建议不要使用它。请使用其他历史记录过滤工具，例如git filter-repo。如果仍然需要使用 git filter-branch ，请仔细阅读安全性（和PERFORMANCE）以了解filter-branch的地雷，然后警惕地尽可能避免此处列出的许多危害。

trans-unit.source: git filter-branch refuses to start with an existing temporary directory or when there are already refs starting with refs/original/, unless forced.
trans-unit.target: git filter-branch 拒绝以现有的临时目录开头，或者拒绝已有以 refs/original/ 开头的引用，除非强制执行。

trans-unit.source: git format-patch -M upstream..topic to turn them into preformatted patch files
trans-unit.target: git format-patch -M upstream..topic 将它们转换为预格式化的补丁文件

trans-unit.source: git format-patch can include an initial "cover letter". You can insert commentary on individual patches after the three dash line which format-patch places after the commit message but before the patch itself. If you use git notes to track your cover letter material, git format-patch --notes will include the commit’s notes in a similar manner.
trans-unit.target: git format-patch 可以包含首字母“ cover letter”。您可以在单独的修补程序上插入三条虚线， format-patch 将这些注释放在提交消息之后，但修补程序本身之前。如果您使用 git notes 来跟踪您的求职信材料，则 git format-patch --notes 将以类似方式包括提交的注释。

trans-unit.source: git gc tries very hard not to delete objects that are referenced anywhere in your repository. In particular, it will keep not only objects referenced by your current set of branches and tags, but also objects referenced by the index, remote-tracking branches, notes saved by git notes under refs/notes/, reflogs (which may reference commits in branches that were later amended or rewound), and anything else in the refs/* namespace. If you are expecting some objects to be deleted and they aren’t, check all of those locations and decide whether it makes sense in your case to remove those references.
trans-unit.target: git gc 尽力不删除存储库中任何地方引用的对象。特别是，它将不仅保留当前分支和标记集引用的对象，还保留索引，远程跟踪分支， git notes 保存在refs / notes /下的reflogs（reflogs（可能引用提交）中的对象）引用的对象。分支，这些分支随后会被修改或倒回），以及refs / *名称空间中的其他任何内容。如果您希望某些对象被删除而不是被删除，请检查所有这些位置，然后决定删除这些引用是否对您有意义。

trans-unit.source: git gui is actually maintained as an independent project, but stable versions are distributed as part of the Git suite for the convenience of end users.
trans-unit.target: git gui 实际上是作为一个独立的项目维护的，但是为了最终用户的方便，稳定版作为Git套件的一部分分发。

trans-unit.source: git gui is known to work on all popular UNIX systems, Mac OS X, and Windows (under both Cygwin and MSYS). To the extent possible OS specific user interface guidelines are followed, making git gui a fairly native interface for users.
trans-unit.target: git gui 已知git gui可在所有流行的UNIX系统，Mac OS X和Windows（在Cygwin和MSYS下）上工作。在一定程度上遵循了特定于OS的用户界面指南，使 git gui 成为用户的本机界面。

trans-unit.source: git http-backend relies upon the CGI environment variables set by the invoking web server, including:
trans-unit.target: git http-backend 依赖于调用Web服务器设置的 CGI 环境变量，包括：

trans-unit.source: git init may copy hooks to the new repository, depending on its configuration. See the "TEMPLATE DIRECTORY" section in git-init[1] for details. When the rest of this document refers to "default hooks" it’s talking about the default template shipped with Git.
trans-unit.target: git init 可能会将钩子复制到新的存储库，具体取决于其配置。有关详细信息，请参见git-init [1]中的“模板目录”部分。当本文档的其余部分提到“默认挂钩”时，它所指的是Git附带的默认模板。

trans-unit.source: git log looks more complicated in C than it does in the original script, but that allows for a much greater flexibility and performance.
trans-unit.target: git log 在C语言中看起来比在原始脚本中要复杂得多，但这可以提供更大的灵活性和性能。

trans-unit.source: git log, git show, git blame and friends look at the encoding header of a commit object, and try to re-code the log message into UTF-8 unless otherwise specified. You can specify the desired output encoding with i18n.logOutputEncoding in .git/config file, like this:
trans-unit.target: git log 除非另有说明，否则git log， git show ， git blame 和朋友将查看提交对象的 encoding 标头，并尝试将日志消息重新编码为UTF-8。您可以指定与编码所期望的输出 i18n.logOutputEncoding 中 .git/config 文件，如下所示：

trans-unit.source: git ls-files --unmerged and git ls-files --stage can be used to examine detailed information on unmerged paths.
trans-unit.target: git ls-files --unmerged 和 git ls-files --stage 可用于检查有关未合并路径的详细信息。

trans-unit.source: git ls-files also requires its own --recurse-submodules flag.

git ls-files can use a list of "exclude patterns" when traversing the directory tree and finding files to show when the flags --others or --ignored are specified. gitignore[5] specifies the format of exclude patterns.
trans-unit.target: git ls-files 当遍历目录树并查找文件以显示指定了--others或--ignored标志时，git ls文件可以使用“排除模式”列表。gitignore [5]指定排除模式的格式。

trans-unit.source: git ls-files just outputs the filenames unless --stage is specified in which case it outputs:
trans-unit.target: git ls-files 除非指定 --stage ,否则git ls-files仅输出文件名，在这种情况下，它将输出：

trans-unit.source: git maintenance register will also disable foreground maintenance by setting maintenance.auto = false in the current repository. This config setting will remain after a git maintenance unregister command.

git merge --abort is equivalent to git reset --merge when MERGE_HEAD is present unless MERGE_AUTOSTASH is also present in which case git merge --abort applies the stash entry to the worktree whereas git reset --merge will save the stashed changes in the stash list.
git merge --abort is equivalent to git reset --merge when MERGE_HEAD is present.
trans-unit.target: git merge --abort 相当于 git reset --merge 当 MERGE_HEAD 存在。

trans-unit.source: git merge-base --fork-point origin/master topic is designed to help in such a case. It takes not only B but also B0, B1, and B2 (i.e. old tips of the remote-tracking branches your repository’s reflog knows about) into account to see on which commit your topic branch was built and finds B0, allowing you to replay only the commits on your topic, excluding the commits the other side later discarded.
trans-unit.target: git merge-base --fork-point origin/master topic 旨在在这种情况下提供帮助。它不仅考虑了B，还考虑了B0，B1和B2（即，您的存储库的reflog知道的远程跟踪分支的旧技巧），以了解在哪个commit上构建了您的主题分支并找到了B0，从而仅允许重播关于您主题的提交，但不包括后来被丢弃的另一方提交。

trans-unit.source: git merge-base finds best common ancestor(s) between two commits to use in a three-way merge. One common ancestor is better than another common ancestor if the latter is an ancestor of the former. A common ancestor that does not have any better common ancestor is a best common ancestor, i.e. a merge base. Note that there can be more than one merge base for a pair of commits.
trans-unit.target: git merge-base 在两次提交之间找到最佳的共同祖先，以用于三向合并。如果另一个共同祖先是前一个共同祖先，则它比另一个共同祖先 better 。没有更好的共同祖先的共同祖先就是 best common ancestor ，即 merge base 。请注意，一对提交可以有多个合并基础。

trans-unit.source: git merge-file incorporates all changes that lead from the <base-file> to <other-file> into <current-file>. The result ordinarily goes into <current-file>. git merge-file is useful for combining separate changes to an original. Suppose <base-file> is the original, and both <current-file> and <other-file> are modifications of <base-file>, then git merge-file combines both changes.
trans-unit.target: git merge-file 将所有从 <base-file> 到 <other-file> 的更改合并到 <current-file> 中。结果通常进入 <current-file> 。 git merge-file 对于将单独的更改组合到原始文件很有用。假设 <base-file> 是原始文件，并且 <current-file> 和 <other-file> 都是 <base-file> 的修改，然后 git merge-file 合并了这两个更改。

trans-unit.source: git merge-file is designed to be a minimal clone of RCS merge; that is, it implements all of RCS merge's functionality which is needed by git[1].
trans-unit.target: git merge-file 被设计为RCS merge 的最小副本；也就是说，它实现了git [1]所需的所有RCS merge 的功能。

trans-unit.source: git merge-one-file script is called with parameters to describe those three versions, and is responsible to leave the merge results in the working tree. It is a fairly straightforward shell script, and eventually calls merge program from RCS suite to perform a file-level 3-way merge. In this case, merge detects conflicts, and the merge result with conflict marks is left in the working tree.. This can be seen if you run ls-files --stage again at this point:
trans-unit.target: git merge-one-file 使用参数来描述这三个版本的git merge-one-file脚本被调用，并负责将合并结果保留在工作树中。这是一个非常简单的shell脚本，最终会从RCS套件中调用 merge 程序来执行文件级三向合并。在这种情况下， merge 将检测到冲突，并且带有冲突标记的合并结果将保留在工作树中。如果 ls-files --stage 再次运行ls-files --stage可以看到这一点：

trans-unit.source: git merge command, when merging two branches, uses 3-way merge algorithm. First, it finds the common ancestor between them. The command it uses is git merge-base:
trans-unit.target: git merge 命令，当合并两个分支时，使用三向合并算法。首先，它找到它们之间的共同祖先。它使用的命令是 git merge-base ：

trans-unit.source: git mergetool creates *.orig backup files while resolving merges. These are safe to remove once a file has been merged and its git mergetool session has completed.
trans-unit.target: git mergetool 在解决合并时创建 *.orig 备份文件。一旦文件已合并且其 git mergetool 会话已完成，即可安全删除这些文件。

trans-unit.source: git pack-redundant accepts a list of objects on standard input. Any objects given will be ignored when checking which packs are required. This makes the following command useful when wanting to remove packs which contain unreachable objects.
trans-unit.target: git pack-redundant 接受标准输入中的对象列表。检查所需包装时，将忽略给定的任何对象。当要删除包含不可达对象的包时，以下命令很有用。

trans-unit.source: git pull fetches from origin by default and merges into the current branch.
trans-unit.target: git pull 默认从 origin 获取并合并到当前分支中。

trans-unit.source: git pull is slightly cumbersome for HTTP transport, as a packed repository may contain relatively few objects in a relatively large pack. If you expect many HTTP pulls from your public repository you might want to repack & prune often, or never.
trans-unit.target: git pull 对于HTTP传输来说有点麻烦，因为打包的存储库可能在相对较大的包中包含相对较少的对象。如果您希望从公共存储库中提取许多HTTP消息，则可能需要重新包装和修剪，或者永远不要重新包装和修剪。

trans-unit.source: git push <remote> <branch> and tell everyone where they can fetch from.
trans-unit.target: git push <remote> <branch> 并告诉每个人可以从哪里获取。

trans-unit.source: git range-diff also accepts the regular diff options (see git-diff[1]), most notably the --color=[<when>] and --no-color options. These options are used when generating the "diff between patches", i.e. to compare the author, commit message and diff of corresponding old/new commits. There is currently no means to tweak most of the diff options passed to git log when generating those patches.
trans-unit.target: git range-diff 也接受常规的diff选项（请参阅git-diff [1]），最著名的是 --color=[<when>] 和 --no-color 选项。这些选项在生成“补丁之间的差异”时使用，即比较作者，提交消息和相应的旧/新提交的差异。当前没有办法在生成这些补丁时调整传递给 git log 的大多数diff选项。

trans-unit.source: git read-tree and other merge-based commands (git merge, git checkout…​) can help maintaining the skip-worktree bitmap and working directory update. $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout is used to define the skip-worktree reference bitmap. When git read-tree needs to update the working directory, it resets the skip-worktree bit in the index based on this file, which uses the same syntax as .gitignore files. If an entry matches a pattern in this file, skip-worktree will not be set on that entry. Otherwise, skip-worktree will be set.
trans-unit.target: git read-tree 和其他基于合并的命令（ git merge ， git checkout …）可以帮助维护skip-worktree位图和工作目录更新。 $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout 用于定义跳过工作树参考位图。当 git read-tree 需要更新工作目录时，它将根据此文件重置索引中的skip-worktree位，该文件使用与.gitignore文件相同的语法。如果条目与此文件中的模式匹配，则不会在该条目上设置skip-worktree。否则，将设置skip-worktree。

trans-unit.source: git rebase will stop when "pick" has been replaced with "edit" or when a command fails due to merge errors. When you are done editing and/or resolving conflicts you can continue with git rebase --continue.
trans-unit.target: git rebase 当“ pick”已被“ edit”替换或由于合并错误而导致命令失败时，git rebase将停止。完成编辑和/或解决冲突后，可以继续使用 git rebase --continue 。

trans-unit.source: git reflog delete accepts options --updateref, --rewrite, -n, --dry-run, and --verbose, with the same meanings as when they are used with expire.
trans-unit.target: git reflog delete 接受 --updateref ，-- --rewrite ， -n ，-- --dry-run 和 --verbose 选项，其含义与与 expire 一起使用时的含义相同。

trans-unit.source: git reflog expire removes reflog entries older than this time and are not reachable from the current tip; defaults to 30 days. The value "now" expires all entries immediately, and "never" suppresses expiration altogether. With "<pattern>" (e.g. "refs/stash") in the middle, the setting applies only to the refs that match the <pattern>.
trans-unit.target: git reflog expire 删除比这个时间更旧的reflog条目，并且从当前提示中无法访问；默认为30天。值“现在”立即使所有条目到期，而“从不”则完全禁止到期。中间带有“ <pattern>”（例如“ refs / stash”），此设置仅适用于与<pattern>匹配的refs。

trans-unit.source: git reflog expire removes reflog entries older than this time; defaults to 90 days. The value "now" expires all entries immediately, and "never" suppresses expiration altogether. With "<pattern>" (e.g. "refs/stash") in the middle the setting applies only to the refs that match the <pattern>.
trans-unit.target: git reflog expire 删除比这个时间旧的reflog条目；默认为90天。值“现在”立即使所有条目到期，而“从不”则完全禁止到期。中间带有“ <pattern>”（例如“ refs / stash”），此设置仅适用于与<pattern>匹配的refs。

trans-unit.source: git reflog show accepts any of the options accepted by git log.
trans-unit.target: git reflog show 接受 git log 接受的任何选项。

trans-unit.source: git repack the public repository. This establishes a big pack that contains the initial set of objects as the baseline, and possibly git prune if the transport used for pulling from your repository supports packed repositories.
trans-unit.target: git repack 公共存储库。这将建立一个大包，其中包含初始对象集作为基线，如果从存储库中提取的传输支持打包的存储库，则可能包含 git prune 。

trans-unit.source: git reset can also be used to restore the index, overlapping with git restore.
trans-unit.target: git reset 也可以用来还原索引，与 git restore 重叠。

trans-unit.source: git rev-list is the original version of the revision walker, which always printed a list of revisions to stdout. It is still functional, and needs to, since most new Git commands start out as scripts using git rev-list.
trans-unit.target: git rev-list 是修订版walker的原始版本，该版本 always 将修订版列表打印到stdout。由于大多数新的Git命令都是使用 git rev-list 作为脚本开始的，因此它仍然可以正常工作，并且仍然需要。

trans-unit.source: git rev-parse --parseopt input format is fully text based. It has two parts, separated by a line that contains only --. The lines before the separator (should be one or more) are used for the usage. The lines after the separator describe the options.
trans-unit.target: git rev-parse --parseopt 输入格式完全基于文本。它分为两部分，用仅包含 -- 的行分隔。使用分隔符之前的行（应为一个或多个）。分隔符之后的行描述了这些选项。

trans-unit.source: git rev-parse is not as important any more; it was only used to filter out options that were relevant for the different plumbing commands that were called by the script.
trans-unit.target: git rev-parse 不再重要了；它仅用于过滤与脚本调用的不同管道命令相关的选项。

trans-unit.source: git rm normally outputs one line (in the form of an rm command) for each file removed. This option suppresses that output.
trans-unit.target: git rm 通常为删除的每个文件输出一行（以 rm 命令的形式）。此选项禁止输出。

trans-unit.source: git sh-i18n--envsubst is Git’s stripped-down copy of the GNU envsubst(1) program that comes with the GNU gettext package. It’s used internally by git-sh-i18n[1] to interpolate the variables passed to the eval_gettext function.
git shell accepts the following commands after the -c option:
trans-unit.target: git shell 在 -c 选项之后接受以下命令：

trans-unit.source: git submodule sync synchronizes all submodules while git submodule sync -- A synchronizes submodule "A" only.
trans-unit.target: git submodule sync 同步所有子模块，而 git submodule sync -- A 仅同步子模块“ A”。

trans-unit.source: git svn dcommit returns immediately if answer is "no" or "quit", without committing anything to SVN.
trans-unit.target: git svn dcommit 如果答案为“否”或“退出”，则git svn dcommit立即返回，而无需向SVN提交任何内容。

trans-unit.source: git svn fetch and git svn rebase automatically update the rev_map if it is missing or not up to date. git svn reset automatically rewinds it.
trans-unit.target: git svn fetch 和 git svn rebase 如果rev_map丢失或不是最新的，则会自动更新。 git svn reset 自动倒带。

trans-unit.source: git svn can track a standard Subversion repository, following the common "trunk/branches/tags" layout, with the --stdlayout option. It can also follow branches and tags in any layout with the -T/-t/-b options (see options to init below, and also the clone command).
trans-unit.target: git svn 可以使用--stdlayout选项，按照常见的“ trunk / branches / tags”布局跟踪标准的Subversion存储库。它也可以使用-T / -t / -b选项跟随任何布局中的分支和标签（请参阅下面的 init 选项以及 clone 命令）。

trans-unit.source: git svn is a simple conduit for changesets between Subversion and Git. It provides a bidirectional flow of changes between a Subversion and a Git repository.
trans-unit.target: git svn 是Subversion和Git之间变更集的简单管道。它提供了Subversion和Git存储库之间的双向更改流。

trans-unit.source: git svn stores [svn-remote] configuration information in the repository $GIT_DIR/config file. It is similar the core Git [remote] sections except fetch keys do not accept glob arguments; but they are instead handled by the branches and tags keys. Since some SVN repositories are oddly configured with multiple projects glob expansions such those listed below are allowed:
trans-unit.target: git svn 将[svn-remote]配置信息存储在存储库$ GIT_DIR / config文件中。它与核心Git [remote]部分相似，除了 fetch 键不接受glob参数；但是它们由 branches 和 tags 键处理。由于某些SVN存储库配置有多个项目，因此怪异地允许进行全局扩展，例如以下所列：

trans-unit.source: git switch refuses when the wanted ref is already checked out by another worktree. This option makes it check the ref out anyway. In other words, the ref can be held by more than one worktree.
trans-unit.target: git switch 当所需的引用已经被另一个工作树检出时，git switch拒绝。此选项使它仍然可以检查引用。换句话说，ref可以由一个以上的工作树保存。

trans-unit.source: git symbolic-ref will exit with status 0 if the contents of the symbolic ref were printed correctly, with status 1 if the requested name is not a symbolic ref, or 128 if another error occurs.
trans-unit.target: git symbolic-ref 如果正确打印了符号引用的内容，则git symbolic-ref将以状态0退出；如果所请求的名称不是符号引用，则git状态符号退出为1；如果发生其他错误，则退出状态为128。

trans-unit.source: git-cvsserver maps Git branches to CVS modules. This is very different from what most CVS users would expect since in CVS modules usually represent one or more directories.
trans-unit.target: git-cvsserver 将Git分支映射到CVS模块。这与大多数CVS用户所期望的完全不同，因为CVS模块中通常代表一个或多个目录。

trans-unit.source: git-cvsserver uses one database per Git head (i.e. CVS module) to store information about the repository to maintain consistent CVS revision numbers. The database needs to be updated (i.e. written to) after every commit.
trans-unit.target: git-cvsserver 每个Git头（即CVS模块）使用一个数据库来存储有关存储库的信息，以保持一致的CVS版本号。每次提交后都需要更新（即写入）数据库。

trans-unit.source: git-cvsserver uses the Perl DBI module. Please also read its documentation if changing these variables, especially about DBI->connect().
trans-unit.target: git-cvsserver 使用Perl DBI模块。如果更改这些变量，尤其是有关 DBI->connect() 的信息，也请阅读其文档。

trans-unit.source: git-difftool invokes a diff tool individually on each file. Errors reported by the diff tool are ignored by default. Use --trust-exit-code to make git-difftool exit when an invoked diff tool returns a non-zero exit code.
trans-unit.target: git-difftool 在每个文件上分别调用一个diff工具。默认情况下，将忽略差异工具报告的错误。当调用的差异工具返回非零退出代码时，请使用 --trust-exit-code 使 git-difftool 退出。

trans-unit.source: git-difftool will forward the exit code of the invoked tool when --trust-exit-code is used.
trans-unit.target: git-difftool 当使用 --trust-exit-code 时，git-difftool将转发被调用工具的退出代码。

trans-unit.source: git-receive-pack honours the receive.denyNonFastForwards config option, which tells it if updates to a ref should be denied if they are not fast-forwards.
trans-unit.target: git-receive-pack 接受 receive.denyNonFastForwards配置选项，该选项告诉它如果不是快速转发，是否应拒绝对ref的更新。

trans-unit.source: git: the anonymous git protocol over a direct TCP connection (or proxy, if configured)
trans-unit.target: git ：通过直接TCP连接（或代理，如果已配置）的匿名git协议

trans-unit.source: gitk is actually maintained as an independent project, but stable versions are distributed as part of the Git suite for the convenience of end users.
trans-unit.target: gitk 实际上是作为一个独立项目维护的，但是为了最终用户的方便，稳定版本作为Git套件的一部分分发。

trans-unit.source: golang suitable for source code in the Go language.
http: git over http, both "smart http" and "dumb http". Note that this does not include https; if you want to configure both, you must do so individually.
trans-unit.target: http ：git over http，既是“ smart http”又是“ dumb http”。请注意，这并 not 包括 https ; 如果要同时配置两者，则必须分别进行配置。

trans-unit.source: incremental: This setting optimizes for performing small maintenance activities that do not delete any data. This does not schedule the gc task, but runs the prefetch and commit-graph tasks hourly and the loose-objects and incremental-repack tasks daily.
indent-with-non-tab treats a line that is indented with space characters instead of the equivalent tabs as an error (not enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: indent-with-non-tab 将缩进空格而不是等效制表符的行视为错误（默认情况下未启用）。

trans-unit.source: index.version=4 enables path-prefix compression in the index.
trans-unit.target: index.version=4 启用索引中的路径前缀压缩。

trans-unit.source: int: canonicalize values as simple decimal numbers. An optional suffix of k, m, or g will cause the value to be multiplied by 1024, 1048576, or 1073741824 upon input.
trans-unit.target: int ：将值规范化为简单的十进制数字。输入 k ， m 或 g 的可选后缀将使该值在输入时乘以1024、1048576或1073741824。

trans-unit.source: java suitable for source code in the Java language.
trans-unit.target: java 适用于Java语言中的源代码。

trans-unit.source: key=<K>: only show trailers with specified key. Matching is done case-insensitively and trailing colon is optional. If option is given multiple times trailer lines matching any of the keys are shown. This option automatically enables the only option so that non-trailer lines in the trailer block are hidden. If that is not desired it can be disabled with only=false. E.g., %(trailers:key=Reviewed-by) shows trailer lines with key Reviewed-by.
trans-unit.target: key=<K> ：仅显示具有指定密钥的预告片。匹配不区分大小写，结尾的冒号是可选的。如果多次给出选项，则显示与任何键匹配的预告片行。此选项自动启用 only 选项，以便隐藏预告片中的非预告线。如果不希望这样，可以使用 only=false 禁用它。例如， %(trailers:key=Reviewed-by) 显示带有键“ Reviewed-by ”的预告片行。
long ：<替换的sha1>（<替换的类型>）→<替换的sha1>（<替换的类型>）

trans-unit.source: ls-refs is the command used to request a reference advertisement in v2. Unlike the current reference advertisement, ls-refs takes in arguments which can be used to limit the refs sent from the server.
trans-unit.target: ls-refs 是用于在v2中请求参考广告的命令。与当前的参考广告不同，ls-refs接受可用于限制从服务器发送的ref的参数。

trans-unit.source: m and ? are applied recursively. For example if a nested submodule in a submodule contains an untracked file, this is reported as ? as well.
trans-unit.target: m 和 ? 递归应用。例如，如果子模块中的嵌套子模块包含未跟踪的文件，则报告为 ? 也一样

trans-unit.source: maint tracks the commits that should go into the next "maintenance release", i.e., update of the last released stable version;
trans-unit.target: maint 跟踪应包含在下一个“维护版本”中的提交，即最近发布的稳定版本的更新；

trans-unit.source: master tracks the commits that should go into the next release;
trans-unit.target: master 跟踪应该发布到下一个版本中的提交；

trans-unit.source: matching - Shows ignored files and directories matching an ignore pattern.
trans-unit.target: matching -显示与忽略模式匹配的被忽略文件和目录。

trans-unit.source: matching - push all branches having the same name on both ends. This makes the repository you are pushing to remember the set of branches that will be pushed out (e.g. if you always push maint and master there and no other branches, the repository you push to will have these two branches, and your local maint and master will be pushed there).
trans-unit.target: matching -在两端推送具有相同名称的所有分支。这使您要推送的存储库记住将要推出的分支集（例如，如果您始终将 maint 和 master 推送到那里，而没有其他分支，则推送到的存储库将具有这两个分支，以及本地的 maint 和 master 将被推到那里）。

trans-unit.source: matlab suitable for source code in the MATLAB and Octave languages.
trans-unit.target: matlab 适用于MATLAB和Octave语言中的源代码。

trans-unit.source: misc-by will avoid including anyone mentioned in Acked-by, Reviewed-by, Tested-by and other "-by" lines in the patch body, except Signed-off-by (use sob for that).
trans-unit.target: misc-by 将避免在修补程序主体中包括Acked-by，Reviewed-by，Tested-by和其他“ -by”行中提及的任何内容，但Sign-off-by除外（为此请使用 sob ）。

trans-unit.source: move refuses to move a locked working tree unless --force is specified twice.
trans-unit.target: move 除非指定两次 --force ,否则move拒绝移动锁定的工作树。

trans-unit.source: move refuses to move a locked working tree unless --force is specified twice. If the destination is already assigned to some other working tree but is missing (for instance, if <new-path> was deleted manually), then --force allows the move to proceed; use --force twice if the destination is locked.

trans-unit.target: negotiate -GSS协商身份验证（比较 curl(1) 的--negotiate选项）

trans-unit.source: never - protocol is never able to be used.

trans-unit.target: never 不会在发送之前永远不会确认

trans-unit.source: next is intended as a testing branch for topics being tested for stability for master.
trans-unit.target: next 旨在作为主题的测试分支，以供测试母版稳定性。

trans-unit.source: none: This default setting implies no task are run at any schedule.
nothing - do not push anything (error out) unless a refspec is explicitly given. This is primarily meant for people who want to avoid mistakes by always being explicit.
trans-unit.target: nothing 做-除非明确给出refspec，否则不要推送任何内容（错误）。这主要是针对那些希望始终保持露骨以避免错误的人。

trans-unit.source: nothing - do not push anything (error out) unless a refspec is given. This is primarily meant for people who want to avoid mistakes by always being explicit.
nowarn turns off the trailing whitespace warning.
objc suitable for source code in the Objective-C language.

only[=val]: select whether non-trailer lines from the trailer block should be included. The only keyword may optionally be followed by an equal sign and one of true, on, yes to omit or false, off, no to show the non-trailer lines. If option is given without value it is enabled. If given multiple times the last value is used.
trans-unit.target: only[=val] ：选择是否应包含来自拖车块的非拖车线。的 only 关键字可以任选地后跟一个等号和一个 true ， on ， yes 省略或 false ， off ， no 显示非拖车线。如果给出的选项没有值，则启用它。如果多次给出，则使用最后一个值。

trans-unit.source: option dry-run {true|false}: If true, pretend the operation completed successfully, but don’t actually change any repository data. For most helpers this only applies to the push, if supported.
trans-unit.target: option dry-run { true | false ：如果为true，则假装操作成功完成，但实际上不更改任何存储库数据。对于大多数助手，这仅适用于 push （如果支持）。

trans-unit.source: pack.useSparse=true uses a new algorithm when constructing a pack-file which can improve git push performance in repos with many files.
trans-unit.target: pack.useSparse=true 构造一个打包文件时使用了一种新算法，该算法可以提高带有许多文件的存储库中的 git push 性能。

trans-unit.source: pager.branch is only respected when listing branches, i.e., when --list is used or implied. The default is to use a pager. See git-config[1].
trans-unit.target: pager.branch 仅在列出分支时（即使用或隐含 --list 时）才使用pager.branch。默认为使用寻呼机。参见git-config [1]。

trans-unit.source: pager.config is only respected when listing configuration, i.e., when using --list or any of the --get-* which may return multiple results. The default is to use a pager.
trans-unit.target: pager.config 仅在列出配置时才使用pager.config，即使用 --list 或任何 --get-* 可能会返回多个结果时。默认为使用寻呼机。

trans-unit.source: pager.tag is only respected when listing tags, i.e., when -l is used or implied. The default is to use a pager. See git-config[1].
trans-unit.target: pager.tag 仅当列出标签时（即，使用或暗示使用 -l 时），才使用pager.tag。默认为使用寻呼机。参见git-config [1]。

trans-unit.source: pascal suitable for source code in the Pascal/Delphi language.
trans-unit.target: pascal 适用于Pascal / Delphi语言的源代码。

trans-unit.source: path: canonicalize by adding a leading ~ to the value of $HOME and ~user to the home directory for the specified user. This specifier has no effect when setting the value (but you can use git config section.variable ~/ from the command line to let your shell do the expansion.)
trans-unit.target: path ：通过增加。规范化的领先 ~ 到价值 $HOME 和 ~user 的主目录为指定的用户。该说明符在设置值时无效（但是您可以从命令行使用 git config section.variable ~/ 让外壳程序进行扩展。）

trans-unit.source: perl suitable for source code in the Perl language.
php suitable for source code in the PHP language.
trans-unit.target: php 适用于PHP语言中的源代码。
plink 或 putty -[-P端口] [-4] [-6] [用户名@]主机命令

trans-unit.source: policy - Delegates if and only if the OK-AS-DELEGATE flag is set in the Kerberos service ticket, which is a matter of realm policy.
trans-unit.target: policy -仅当在Kerberos服务票证中设置了OK-AS-DELEGATE标志时委托，这是领域策略的问题。

trans-unit.source: pu (proposed updates) is an integration branch for things that are not quite ready for inclusion yet (see "Integration Branches" below).
trans-unit.target: pu （建议的更新）是一个集成分支，用于尚未准备好包含的事物（请参阅下面的“集成分支”）。

trans-unit.source: python suitable for source code in the Python language.
trans-unit.target: python 适用于Python语言中的源代码。

trans-unit.source: remove refuses to remove an unclean working tree unless --force is used. To remove a locked working tree, specify --force twice.
trans-unit.target: remove 除非使用 --force ,否则remove拒绝删除不洁的工作树。要删除锁定的工作树，请两次指定 --force 。

trans-unit.source: reset --keep is meant to be used when removing some of the last commits in the current branch while keeping changes in the working tree. If there could be conflicts between the changes in the commit we want to remove and the changes in the working tree we want to keep, the reset is disallowed. That’s why it is disallowed if there are both changes between the working tree and HEAD, and between HEAD and the target. To be safe, it is also disallowed when there are unmerged entries.
trans-unit.target: reset --keep 旨在在保留当前工作树中的更改的同时删除当前分支中的某些最后提交时使用。如果我们要删除的提交中的更改与我们要保留的工作树中的更改之间可能存在冲突，则不允许进行重置。这就是为什么如果工作树与 HEAD 之间以及 HEAD 与目标之间都没有更改的情况，则不允许这样做。为了安全起见，在存在未合并的条目时也不允许这样做。

trans-unit.source: reset --merge is meant to be used when resetting out of a conflicted merge. Any mergy operation guarantees that the working tree file that is involved in the merge does not have a local change with respect to the index before it starts, and that it writes the result out to the working tree. So if we see some difference between the index and the target and also between the index and the working tree, then it means that we are not resetting out from a state that a mergy operation left after failing with a conflict. That is why we disallow --merge option in this case.
trans-unit.target: reset --merge 用于从冲突合并中重置时使用。任何mergy操作都可以确保合并中涉及的工作树文件在开始之前不会对索引进行本地更改，并且可以将结果写到工作树中。因此，如果我们看到索引与目标之间以及索引与工作树之间存在一些差异，则意味着我们没有从因冲突失败而导致的mergy操作退出的状态中退出。这就是为什么我们在这种情况下不允许 --merge 选项的原因。

trans-unit.source: rev-list is a very essential Git command, since it provides the ability to build and traverse commit ancestry graphs. For this reason, it has a lot of different options that enables it to be used by commands as different as git bisect and git repack.
trans-unit.target: rev-list 是非常必要的Git命令，因为它提供了建立和遍历提交祖先图的功能。因此，它具有许多不同的选项，使得它可以被 git bisect 和 git repack 之类的命令使用。

trans-unit.source: rev-list walks backwards through history, including or excluding commits based on whether --full-history and/or parent rewriting (via --parents or --children) are used. The following settings are available.
trans-unit.target: rev-list 可 --full-history 历史，包括或基于是否使用--full-history和/或父级重写（通过 --parents 或 --children ）进行提交。可以使用以下设置。

trans-unit.source: ruby suitable for source code in the Ruby language.
rust suitable for source code in the Rust language.
seen (patches seen by the maintainer) is an integration branch for things that are not quite ready for inclusion yet (see "Integration Branches" below).

separator=<SEP>: specify a separator inserted between trailer lines. When this option is not given each trailer line is terminated with a line feed character. The string SEP may contain the literal formatting codes described above. To use comma as separator one must use %x2C as it would otherwise be parsed as next option. If separator option is given multiple times only the last one is used. E.g., %(trailers:key=Ticket,separator=%x2C ) shows all trailer lines whose key is "Ticket" separated by a comma and a space.
trans-unit.target: separator=<SEP> ：指定在尾行之间插入的分隔符。如果未指定此选项，则每个尾随行都以换行符终止。字符串SEP可能包含上述文字格式代码。要将逗号用作分隔符，必须使用 %x2C ，否则将其解析为下一个选项。如果多次给出了分隔符选项，则仅使用最后一个。例如， %(trailers:key=Ticket,separator=%x2C ) 显示所有键为“ Ticket”且由逗号和空格分隔的预告片行。

trans-unit.source: simple - in centralized workflow, work like upstream with an added safety to refuse to push if the upstream branch’s name is different from the local one.
trans-unit.target: simple -在集中式工作流程中，如果上游分支机构的名称与本地分支机构不同，则可以像 upstream 那样工作，并增加了安全性，可以拒绝推送。

trans-unit.source: sob will avoid including anyone mentioned in Signed-off-by lines except for self (use self for that).
trans-unit.target: sob 会避免包括“签署者”行中提及的任何人（ self 除外）（为此请使用self）。

trans-unit.source: sob will avoid including anyone mentioned in the Signed-off-by trailers except for self (use self for that).
space-before-tab treats a space character that appears immediately before a tab character in the initial indent part of the line as an error (enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: space-before-tab 将在行的初始缩进部分中紧接在制表符之前的空格字符视为错误（默认情况下启用）。
ssh ：ssh上的 git（包括 host:path 语法， ssh:// 等）。

trans-unit.source: strip can be used as a synonym to lstrip.
trans-unit.target: strip 可以用作 lstrip 的同义词。

trans-unit.source: tab-in-indent treats a tab character in the initial indent part of the line as an error (not enabled by default).
trans-unit.target: tab-in-indent 将行的初始缩进部分中的制表符视为错误（默认情况下未启用）。

trans-unit.source: tabwidth=<n> tells how many character positions a tab occupies; this is relevant for indent-with-non-tab and when Git fixes tab-in-indent errors. The default tab width is 8. Allowed values are 1 to 63.
trans-unit.target: tabwidth=<n> 指示一个制表符占用多少个字符位置；这 indent-with-non-tab 和Git修复 tab-in-indent 错误有关。默认制表符宽度为8。允许的值是1到63。

trans-unit.source: tag <tag> means the same as refs/tags/<tag>:refs/tags/<tag>; it requests fetching everything up to the given tag.
trans-unit.target: tag <tag> 含义与 refs/tags/<tag>:refs/tags/<tag> ；它要求提取所有内容直到指定的标签。

trans-unit.source: tex suitable for source code for LaTeX documents.
tracking - This is a deprecated synonym for upstream.
traditional - Shows ignored files and directories, unless --untracked-files=all is specified, in which case individual files in ignored directories are displayed.
trans-unit.target: traditional -显示被忽略的文件和目录，除非指定了--untracked-files = all，在这种情况下，将显示被忽略目录中的单个文件。

trans-unit.source: trailer:<field>, the <field> is interpreted as a case-insensitive commit message trailer (see git-interpret-trailers[1]). For example, if your project uses Reviewed-by trailers, you might want to see who has been reviewing with git shortlog -ns --group=trailer:reviewed-by.
trailing-space is a short-hand to cover both blank-at-eol and blank-at-eof.
trans-unit.target: trailing-space 是一种短手为覆盖 blank-at-eol 和 blank-at-eof 。

trans-unit.source: unfold[=val]: make it behave as if interpret-trailer’s --unfold option was given. In same way as to for only it can be followed by an equal sign and explicit value. E.g., %(trailers:only,unfold=true) unfolds and shows all trailer lines.
trans-unit.target: unfold[=val] ：使其表现得像给出了解释拖车的 --unfold 选项一样。与 only 用于的方式相同，其后可以跟等号和显式值。例如， %(trailers:only,unfold=true) 展开并显示所有预告片行。

trans-unit.source: upstream - push the current branch back to the branch whose changes are usually integrated into the current branch (which is called @{upstream}). This mode only makes sense if you are pushing to the same repository you would normally pull from (i.e. central workflow).
trans-unit.target: upstream -将当前分支推回到通常将其更改集成到当前分支中的分支（称为 @{upstream} ）。仅当您推送到通常从中提取的同一存储库（即中央工作流）时，此模式才有意义。

trans-unit.source: user - protocol is only able to be used when GIT_PROTOCOL_FROM_USER is either unset or has a value of 1. This policy should be used when you want a protocol to be directly usable by the user but don’t want it used by commands which execute clone/fetch/push commands without user input, e.g. recursive submodule initialization.
trans-unit.target: user -协议仅能时要使用 GIT_PROTOCOL_FROM_USER 未设置或具有当你想要一个协议是由用户直接使用，但不希望它利用其执行克隆命令，这一政策应使用值1。 / fetch / push命令，无需用户输入，例如，递归子模块初始化。

trans-unit.source: valueonly[=val]: skip over the key part of the trailer line and only show the value part. Also this optionally allows explicit value.
trans-unit.target: valueonly[=val] ：跳过预告片行的关键部分，仅显示值部分。同样，这可以选择允许显式值。

trans-unit.source: warn outputs warnings for a few such errors, but applies the patch as-is (default).
trans-unit.target: warn 输出一些此类错误的警告，但按原样应用补丁（默认）。

trans-unit.source: %G (must be the first characters in an argument)
trans-unit.target: ％G（必须是参数中的第一个字符）
